p: Following infection, EV71 predominantly replicates in the intestinal mucosa and, to a lesser extent, in the respiratory mucosa [ 5, 14]. Subsequently, the virus can enter the bloodstream and disseminate to a variety of organs, including the central nervous system (CNS) [ 15]. EV71 dissemination to the CNS remains a rare event and the viral neurotropic determinants remain ill-defined, despite extensive epidemiological studies and experimentation in animal models.
